Concepts.definition: The concept for an administered component.
The logical, mathematical, and/or other operations specifying derivation. The rule may range from a simple operation such as subtraction to a very complex set of derivations.
Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa":An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A concept is the basic unit of information contained in the Thesaurus. They describe sets of individuals in a given domain. A concept has a name, belongs to a Namespace and exists in relation to other concepts. The vertical relationships consist of "isa" statements that form a logical hierarchy (taxonomy or subsumption graph). In general, concepts above a given concept are referred to as superconcepts or parents and those below as subconcepts or children. In addition, there are horizontal named realationships between concepts called Roles, binary relations between concepts that provide a machine-interpretable definition of a concept and the means for discrimination of sibling concepts. A concept may also include Properties, named slots that allow attachment of external information to concepts.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/13/12 jc  Released as part of caDSR v4.0 model cleanup per direction of model owner (Denise Warzel).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false". Also, a variable of Boolean type or a function with Boolean arguments or result. The most common Boolean functions are AND, OR and NOT. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?Boolean)_A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Conforming to fact or reality or definitive criteria.

Concepts.definition: Conforming to facts, reality or definitive criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not in accordance with the fact or reality or definitive criteria.

Concepts.definition: Not in accordance with facts, reality or definitive criteria.

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false". Also, a variable of Boolean type or a function with Boolean arguments or result. The most common Boolean functions are AND, OR and NOT. (http://foldoc.doc.ic.ac.uk/foldoc/foldoc.cgi?Boolean):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The type of an expression with two possible values, "true" and "false".
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
